references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of curriculum learning, a crucial methodology used in the two-stage training approach of HUMANUP.
This work showcases advanced legged robot locomotion capabilities, providing context for the challenges and successes in humanoid control.

references.paper_title: Deep whole-body control: Learning a unified policy for manipulation and locomotion
references.reason: This paper's focus on unified policies for manipulation and locomotion is relevant to the complex contact requirements of the getting-up task.

references.paper_title: Learning humanoid locomotion over challenging terrain
references.reason: This work demonstrates successful sim-to-real transfer for humanoid locomotion, addressing a key challenge also tackled in HUMANUP.
This paper addresses a similar task of learning getting-up policies for humanoid characters, providing a comparative baseline and highlighting the unique aspects of the presented research.
